doc:
Adolphe Menjou https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Adolphe_Menjou 0 Adolphe Jean Menjou (February 18, 1890 – October 29, 1963) was an American actor. His career spanned both silent films and talkies. He appeared in such films as Charlie Chaplin's A Woman of Paris, where he played the lead role; Stanley Kubrick's Paths of Glory with Kirk Douglas; Ernst Lubitsch's The Marriage Circle; The Sheik with Rudolph Valentino; Morocco with Marlene Dietrich and Gary Cooper; and A Star Is Born with Janet Gaynor and Fredric March, then was nominated for an Academy Award for The Front Page in 1931. Adolphe_Jean_Menjou ( February_18_,_1890 – October_29_,_1963 ) was an_American_actor . His_career spanned both silent_films_and_talkies . He appeared in such_films as Charlie_Chaplin 's_A_Woman of Paris , where he played the_lead_role ; Stanley_Kubrick 's_Paths of Glory with Kirk_Douglas ; Ernst_Lubitsch 's_The_Marriage_Circle ; The_Sheik with Rudolph_Valentino ; Morocco with Marlene_Dietrich and Gary_Cooper ; and A_Star Is_Born with Janet_Gaynor and Fredric_March , then was_nominated for an_Academy_Award for The_Front Page in 1931 .
